Returns or changes the current path.

@1,2@ Returns the absolute path of the current working directory, obtained as if (in native format) by POSIX [https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/getcwd.html {{tt|getcwd}}]. {{v|2}} returns {{c|path()}} if error occurs.

@3,4@ Changes the current working directory to {{c|p}}, as if by POSIX [https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/chdir.html {{tt|chdir}}].

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|path to change the current working directory to}}
{{par|ec|out-parameter for error reporting in the non-throwing overloads}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1,2@ Returns the current working directory.
@3,4@ (none)

===Exceptions===
{{cpp/filesystem/error_handling|throw=1/2}}
{{cpp/filesystem/error_handling|throw=3/4|noexcept=no|p}}

===Notes===
The current working directory is the directory, associated with the process, that is used as the starting location in pathname resolution for relative paths.

The current path as returned by many operating systems is a dangerous global variable. It may be changed unexpectedly by third-party or system library functions, or by another thread.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;filesystem&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
namespace fs = std::filesystem;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Current path is " &lt;&lt; fs::current_path() &lt;&lt; '\n'; // (1)
    fs::current_path(fs::temp_directory_path()); // (3)
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Current path is " &lt;&lt; fs::current_path() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
Current path is "D:/local/ConsoleApplication1"
Current path is "E:/Temp"
}}
